description: Borrowed from Japanese 合気道(あいきどう) (aikidō, “aikido”, literally “way of adapting the spirit”), from 合(あい) (ai, “together, unify”) + 気(き) (ki, “spirit; breath”) + 道(どう) (dō, “way”). Doublet of hapkido.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A Japanese martial art developed from jujitsu and making use of holds and throws.
(countable) A school of the martial art.
